New Records: Jackson Chourio hit a tiebreaking solo homer in the ninth inning, marking his 17th homer of the season; The Brewers achieved their fifth consecutive win and reduced their magic number to 16 for clinching the NL Central title
Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio's tiebreaking solo homer in the ninth inning; Aaron Ashby pitched two scoreless innings for the win; Blake Perkins made a diving stop to rob Noelvi Marte of a potential go-ahead homer
Pre-Game Insights: Milwaukee Brewers’ manager Pat Murphy emphasized the team's resilience and confidence; The Brewers jumped in front with Willy Adames’ three-run drive off Buck Farmer in the third inning
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Ashby (1-2) pitched two scoreless innings for the win; Devin Williams worked a shaky ninth for his eighth save; Milwaukee Brewers’ Jackson Chourio expressed pride in the team's comeback win
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee Brewers became the third team to reach 80 wins this season; Reds manager David Bell praised the Brewers' performance
